review_title: No Loyalty or Advocacy for Current Employees
job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Stone Mountain, GA
pros: 1 hr lunch break. Typically leave at 5pm.
cons:
1. You can be replaced at the drop of a hat. 
2. All employees quit or leave soon after starting because they hate the job. Too much work- expectation is 30 patients per day with minimal support
3. Pay is not worth it. 
4. Management only cares about doctor's opinions and not NP's. They call every NP a nurse and don't recognize our advanced degrees.
5. There is no support from management if something goes wrong.
6. You have to give 60 days advance notice before requesting off. 
7. Most NP's chart 3-6 hrs per night after clinic is over to get their work done.
8. No recognition for a job well done. 
9. Worst place I have ever worked.
10. All NP's I talk to want to quit being an NP after working here.
